meanings.def: any of the parts into which something is divided
examples: section of something That section of the road is still closed.
the tail section of the plane
The library has a large biology section.
Large sections of the forest have been destroyed by acid rain.
You'll find the book in the music section.

meanings.def: a separate part of a structure from which the whole can be put together
examples: The shed comes in sections that you assemble yourself.

meanings.def: a separate part of a document, book, etc.
examples: These issues will be discussed more fully in the next section.
the sports section of the newspaper
The report has a section on accidents at work.
The book is divided into four sections.
It is difficult to navigate from one section of the site to another.
Feel free to add your own ideas in the comments section.
the previous/following/final section
Section by section, this essay examines and explores the key terms.
I skipped the section on garden design.
The book is divided into chapters, sections, and sub-sections.
The new edition of the dictionary adds a section on phrasal verbs.
The case was the first prosecution under Section 3A of the Road Traffic Act 1988.
Section 3 applies to clauses which restrict liability.

meanings.def: a separate group within a larger group of people
examples: section of something an issue that will affect large sections of the population
the brass section of an orchestra
an area populated largely by the poorer sections of society
The way he's been treated by certain sections of the media is despicable.
We've had meetings with all sections of the community.

meanings.def: a department in an organization, institution, etc.
examples: He's the director of the finance section.
the section of the company dealing with customer services
He works in the embassy's political section.
Which section of the company are you working in?
The completed forms are passed to the personnel section for verification.

meanings.def: a district of a town, city or county
examples: the Dorchester section of Boston
one of the city’s most affluent sections

meanings.def: a measure of land, equal to one square mile
a drawing or diagram of something as it would look if it were cut from top to bottom or from one side to the other
examples: section through something The illustration shows a section through a leaf.
in section The architect drew the house in section.

meanings.def: the act of cutting or separating something in an operation
examples: The surgeon performed a section (= made a cut) on the vein.

meanings.def: a very thin flat piece cut from body tissue to be looked at under a microscope
examples: to examine a section from the kidney

meanings.def: to divide body tissue by cutting
to cut animal or plant tissue into thin slices in order to look at it under a microscope
to officially order a mentally ill person to go and receive treatment in a psychiatric hospital, using a law that can force them to stay there until they are successfully treated
examples: be sectioned A few hours before he committed suicide he had been sectioned under the Mental Health Act.
